climbs.name: Step Right Up
climbs.fa: (TR) Chris Miller, Pete Paredes, and Cheryl Basye, July 1999, FL: Chris Miller & Loren Scott, July 1999

content.description:
Start about 25 feet to the left of

Ours

, and proceed up easy slab to a small ledge. The first bolt is right above this small ledge. Once you get to the fourth bolt easy traverse right to the anchors shared with Ours.
content.protection: 4 bolts, to 2 bolt anchor with rap rings
content.location: Obvious line with 4 bolts to the left of the anchor, between Sideshow and Ours

climbs.name: Sideshow
climbs.fa: Ivan Couch and Mike Dent, November, 1970.

content.description: This runout face climb has a few interesting moves, but much of it involves climbing along a unaesthetic ramp.
content.protection: two bolts and some small gear

climbs.name: Showstopper
climbs.fa: (TR) Chris Miller, Pete Paredes, and Cheryl Basye, July 1999, FL: Chris Miller & Jim Robertson, July 1999

content.description:
Begin with the first two bolts of

Ours

and then break right and follow a long waterstreak up the slab passing seven more bolts. The climbing is a fun combination of smearing with positive edges and once past the initial runout section is well-protected.

From the top either rap (165') with two ropes or rap with a single line down to the anchor on Ours and one more to the ground.
content.location:
Right side of the Sideshow Slab with a shared start with

Ours

.

climbs.name: Ours
climbs.fa: Mike Graham, Steve West, and Alan Vick, October 1972

content.description: This is a fairly nice face climb on slick rock.  It is in the shade in the afternoon.  The first pitch is the crux, and the second pitch 5.7.
This is the obvious gully on the right side of Eagle Pinnacle.  It is mostly third and fourth class, with a nice, well-protected 12 foot long vertical lieback at the top.

This is the nice line of edges left of the anchors for

Ours

, and although too close to consider bolting, is worth doing if you've already got the rope in place.
content.location:
Midway between

Step Right Up

and

Ours

.
